itemDescription: United States Marine Corps Medal of Honor recipient

wikipedia_page.main: Henry A. Thompson (1841 – February 16, 1889) was a U.S. Marine stationed aboard the USS Minnesota during the American Civil War. He received the Medal of Honor for his actions during the Second Battle of Fort Fisher on January 15, 1865.

response: * Henry A. Thompson (1841–1889), American Civil War Medal of Honor recipient

However, by the time he was ready to leave for the capital, few Winnebagos lived near his residence and within a year, the federal government began favoring their removal. While visiting the capital, he contracted a severe cold which grew worse when he attempted to travel back to Wisconsin. By the time he reached Baltimore, Maryland, he had become too ill to continue and forced to stop in Barnum's Hotel. However, his condition grew worse and died at the hotel on April 27, 1836. At the time of his death, he had been attended by his brother General Charles Gratiot, General George Wallace Jones, Captain Henry A. Thompson and Chief Justice Roger B. Taney among others.Washburne, Elihu B. "Henry Gratiot, a Pioneer of Wisconsin," Report and Collections of the State Historical Society of Wisconsin, for the years 1883, 1884, 1885, vol. 10 (Madison: The State Historical Society of Wisconsin, 1888): 257.
* Henry A. Thompson (1841–1889), United States Marine and Medal of Honor recipient
